channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very narrow pavement, 29th November
item.description:
A section of pavement at the bus stop on London Rd close to Grevill House is too narrow for wheel chair users to reach the bus stop safely. As a result a wheel chair user recently almost lost wheels over the curb and came close to be tipped over into the road. It could be due to the bank adjoining the pavement encroaching onto the pavement over time, or not enough of the bank was removed when the pavement was constructed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 279, London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: A pothole in pavement problem, 29th November
item.description:
Good morning I would like to report a pothole. It is located outside the entrance to St Edwards, the Sixways site, and the same entrance which serves for the carpark/ Sixways medical practice. The hole is located on the pavement and is about 2 feet in diameter and 10cm deep. IT seems to have been highlighted for repair some time ago but never actually filled in. There are many elderly people who use the pavement regularly and are at risk because of the position and extent of the defect. Kind regards.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 29th November
item.description:
one way street. looked for the No entry sign. It was facing the Road and could not be seen from driving up the Road. If you can turn the sign around so Motorist can see when driving by it could save a lot of Accidents.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign at Bentham Church, 29th November
item.description:
The Dog lane sign by Bentham Church has been hit by a vehicle. I have now re screwed the sign to the posts as best I can. One post is now taller than the other. However the sign is clear to everyone
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Permitted on-footway vehicular parking bay markings are heavily eroded and neither permit holders nor Parking Enforcement Attendees can determine where makings are meant to exist or end. Problem is especially pronounced at southern end of area mentioned., 29th November
item.description:
Gkoucester Rd, on wide f/w on east side of street between tarmacked cut-through to Queens Retreat and St.George's Rd junctions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Gloucester Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: The road closure dates on the entrance to North Street are incorrect, 29th November
item.description:
The road closure dates on the entrance to North Street are incorrect. They state that the road will be closed between 4th - 8th December 2023, when in fact it should read 4th-7th December. This is very important because the town's Xmas Fair is to be held on 8th December and the road needs to be available for stallholders and pedestrians alike. Please can this be amended as a matter of urgency, giving out the correct message.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, North Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Please see additional information in email attached

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 29th November

one gully top needs replacing please can this be assessed and if can be replaced.

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 29th November
item.description:
customer with visual impairment has stated that the crossing once made a beeping noise to indicate that the crossing is safe to pass but there is no longer any beeping. customer has asked if this is a fault and can it be reinstated?
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Many potholes in a row on a large segment of PE Way, 29th November
item.description:
A long stretch of PE Way has a number of larger and deep potholes causing vehicles to swerve to avoid them. Damage could be done to vehicles if they are not avoided.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: One of the unilluminted bollards has bene knocked over. I have moved the sign to a nearby tree as it was lying on the pavement. I am not sure it has been hit by a car, i think it has just been pushed over. The retaining bolts are into tarmac only and are only a few inches long. The tarmac has cracked and sign is totally detached., 29th November
item.description:
It's where I have positioned it on the map. It is a narrowing in the road outside Berkhampstead nursery where children cross the road. Noticed it this morning. Have not been down the road for a few days

item.title: Deep straight edge pothole near side entrance to airport, 29th November
item.description:
Dangerous straight edge pothole on cheltenham road east by side entrance to airport, from cheltenham to Gloucester unavoidable due to road being so narrow now! Could cause serious damage to vehicle or serious injury yo cyclist or motorbike! Is getting worse every day due to amount of traffic using road and not being able to avoid due to now Dangerous width of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victory Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface including previous patch repairs is badly deteriorated, 28th November
item.description:
The majority of the road surface of Harp Hill (in particular outside the Battledown Centre For Children & Families to Greenway Lane) and also Aggs Hill from Mill Lane junction to Birdlip Road junction is in a poor state. The road has been repeatedly patched but really needs resurfacing to bring it back to an acceptable standard especially given the significant volume of traffic that use this route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
